ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Attack speedups
ygData.msgSnippet: Well Kit if they do not need you then go solo :)  Over the weekend I just though a guildmate of mine how to do the all instrument solo in Sk, she can now
ygData.messageBody:
Well Kit if they do not need you then go solo :) Over the weekend I just
though a guildmate of mine how to do the all instrument solo in Sk, she can
now easily take down Aviak Rooks without breaking a sweat. In 2-3 hours of
soloing blues in SK you should be able to gain a level in a week on your
schedule, your only limiting factor will be finding targets, haha.

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Thursday, March 30, 2000 12:46 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Attack speedups
>
>
> Bards are wonderfully powerful if there are no casters around.
> My group is just the opposite, there are no non-casters
> around, guild wide
> pretty much.
>
> I am 23rd level. I don't play enough hours to gain even two
> levels in 3
> weeks though.
> I like Sol A a lot, but I can't be effective in Sol A. I
> can't really tank
> and if a group is caster heavy they really have no other use
> for me. This
> has done nothing but continue to foster my opinion that melee
> classes are
> not useful until you get to the level where they artificially
> created a use
> for them by giving critters insane resists. The cleric can
> tank as well for
> this group as I can. His heals of himself when he tanks are
> sufficient
> taunt to keep the mobs on him and the other casters can
> easily make it a
> one-gob fight 90% of the time.
>
> Kit
>
